intro: Alangium javanicum var. jaheri, commonly known as the Javanese alangium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation. The botanical features of this species make it an important plant in its native ecosystems.
